## Guidlines and suggestions {.centered background-color="`r clrs[1]`"}

::: {.incremental style="font-size: 1.5em"}
-   Slides :ENNHANCE your presentation, not BE the presentation.

-   Remember, only you can prevent [**"Death by PowerPoint"**]{.yellow}
:::

::: notes
Presentation media is to enhance your presentation, not be the presentation. Its only you who can prevent death by PPT
:::

## Slide {background-color="`r clrs[1]`"}

::: {.incremental style="font-size: 1.5em"}
-   Highlight key points

-   Be short and to the point, include only key words and phases for visual, reinforcement

-   text and images should be placed within 95% of the slide. This ["action safe"]{.yellow} area is seen in the next slide.
:::

::: notes
Highlight key points or reinforce what the facilitator is saying Be short and to the point, include only key words and phases for visual, reinforcement In order for your presentation to fit on most screens, text and images should be placed within 95% of the slide. This ["action safe"]{.yellow} area is seen in the next slide.
:::

## 

::: {.incremental stype="font-size: 1.4em"}
-   Layout continuity from frame to frame conveys a sense of completeness
-   Headings, subheadings, and logos should show up in the same spot on each frame
-   Margins, fonts, font size, and colors should be consistent with graphics located in the same general position on each frame
-   Lines, boxes, borders, and open space also should be consistent throughout
:::

## Fonts {background-color="`r clrs_lt[1]`"}

::: {.incremental stype="font-size: 1.6em"}
-   Font Style Should be Readable
-   Recommended fonts: Arial, Tahoma,Veranda
-   Standardize the Font Throughout
:::

-   [The larger, the better.]{style="font-size: 1.4em"}

::: notes
Remember, your slides must be readable, even at the back of the room. Title slide should not be less than 40 on Veranda Subtitile font should not be less than 32 on Veranda Text font should not be less than 24 on Veranda Avoid text font of 12 in slide on Veranda
:::

## Fonts

Don't Sacrifice Readability for Style DON'T SACRIFICE READABILITY FOR STYLE Don't Sacrifice Readability for Style DON'T SACRIFICE READABILITY FOR STYLE

## CAPS

DO NOT USE ALL CAPITAL LETTERS Makes text hard to read Conceals acronyms Denies their use for EMPHASIS Italics Used for "quotes" Used to highlight thoughts or ideas Used for book, journal, or magazine titles

## Use a Template

Use a set font and color scheme. Different styles are disconcerting to the audience. You want the audience to focus on what you present, not the way you present.
